column4: can anyone help me with a problem about the vnc server of ubuntu??
what's your problem?
i setteup my vnc...i left home my pc restarted...and now it's in the logon screen of ubuntu and i cant access it remotly
hmm, couple things to note:  first of all, you will need to open a port on your router to access it remotely.  I believe the port is 5900-- have you done this?
yes
ok.  The other thing is (although I'm not *entirely* sure), but I believe you need to be logged into the Ubuntu machine locally before you can connect remotely
So a good thing to try would be to log in and then try connecting-- do you have an extra laptop or computer you can test with now?
i'm on my girlsfriend laptop
but my pc is not responding on vnc viewer
Have you logged into the Ubuntu machine locally?
no...i'm not home :(
ok, I think you may need to have it logged in to work.  The other thing to make sure is that you're using a correct IP address.  Note that it shouldn't start with 192.168..., as this is your local IP
i have dinamic routable ip
sorry for the bad english at this hour
no problem, I can understand you fine  :)  I'm not sure if there's any way we can get VNC working at this point without logging in first  :-/
damn...this is bad :(
Do you have SSH set up?  Perhaps logging in there would be enough to start the VNC server
i dont think so ..... :|
i'll try to connect with putty now
not respoding with putty

Ok.  Unfortunately, I think we might be out-of-luck at this point.  However, next time you're home, I've found instructions for making VNC work from the login screen: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VNC#VNC%20Server%20with%20Login%20Screen%20via%20GDM
thanks very much :) for your help
no problem.  Good luck
